skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with minimal audit as requested. Files contain local scripts and documentation for skill creation workflows. No risky behavior observed in the scan.

content.value_statement: You need a repeatable process to design high quality Codex skills. This skill provides guidance and scripts to initialize, validate, and package skills in a consistent structure.
actual_capabilities: Initialize a new skill folder with a SKILL.md template and example resources.
Generate example scripts, reference docs, and asset placeholders for new skills.
Validate SKILL.md frontmatter fields, formats, and naming rules.
Check description constraints such as length and angle bracket rules.
Package a skill directory into a .skill zip after validation.
Provide reference patterns for workflows and output templates.
limitations: Requires Python 3 and the PyYAML package to run validation.
Validation only checks frontmatter and naming rules, not full content quality.
Packaging includes all files in the skill folder without filtering.
It does not write final skill content without user edits.

use_cases.title: Start a new skill
use_cases.description: Create a new skill directory quickly and follow a clear structure for resources and guidance.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill quality
use_cases.description: Validate naming and frontmatter rules before sharing skills across teams.

use_cases.title: Design workflow guidance
use_cases.description: Use reference patterns to author clear, consistent instructions and output formats.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I need a new skill for invoice PDF processing. Guide me through initialization and the first edits to SKILL.md.

prompt_templates.title: Improve an existing skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Refine a skill that already exists
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my existing skill for completeness and suggest improvements to frontmatter and structure.

prompt_templates.title: Design workflow references
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me add a sequential workflow section and decide what should move into references files.

prompt_templates.title: Package and validate
prompt_templates.prompt: Tell me how to validate and package my skill, and list the common validation failures to watch for.

output_examples.input: Help me create a new skill for meeting note summarization and package it.
output: Initialized a new skill folder with a SKILL.md template and example resources
Outlined which scripts and references to add for summarization workflows
Explained how to validate and package the skill into a .skill file

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise and move detailed references into separate files.
Use the initializer script to avoid missing required structure.
Validate before packaging to catch frontmatter issues early.
anti_patterns: Adding extra documentation files like README.md or CHANGELOG.md.
Leaving TODO placeholders in SKILL.md or example resources.
Ignoring naming rules for skill folders and frontmatter.

faq.question: Is this compatible with any skill layout?
faq.answer: It expects the standard SKILL.md frontmatter and a skill folder layout.

faq.question: What are the main limits of validation?
faq.answer: Validation checks frontmatter format and naming rules, not full content accuracy.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, you can run the scripts in your build or release pipeline.

faq.question: Does it collect or send data?
faq.answer: No, all scripts operate locally on your filesystem.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: Fix the reported frontmatter issues and rerun the validator.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual setup?
faq.answer: It provides templates and checks that reduce errors and keep structure consistent.
